intro: Nemacladus rigidus var. interior, commonly known as the interior rigid nemacladus, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of North America. It is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and is typically found in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often overlooked due to their size and coloration. Its leaves are usually narrow and rigid, which helps it withstand harsh environmental conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in conservation efforts.
